Name.BusinessNameLine1: MOUNTAIN AREA HEALTH EDUCATION CENTER INC

IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF MOUNTAIN AREA HEALTH EDUCATION CENTER (MAHEC) IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION, INFORMATION, TECHNOLOGY, RESEARCH, TRAINING, AND SERVICES TO IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES IN WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS AND NEUTRALITY. WE CONTINUE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF HEALTHCARE THROUGH RECRUITMENT, RETENTION, DISTRIBUTION, APPROPRIATE UTILIZATION, AND DEVELOPMENT OF A DIVERSE HEALTHCARE WORKFORCE.
IRS990.Description: FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM GRADUATED TWELVE FROM THREE-YEAR PROGRAMS BASED IN ONE URBAN AND TWO RURAL FAMILY HEALTH CENTERS. GERIATRIC MEDICINE ONE-YEAR FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM GRADUATED TWO. OFFICE OF REGIONAL PRIMARY CARE PROVIDED PRECEPTED ROTATIONS FOR HEALTH SCIENCES AND MEDICAL STUDENTS IN OUR 16-COUNTY REGION. SERVICES PROVIDED IN THE HEALTH CENTERS RESULTED IN 52,100 PATIENT ENCOUNTERS. FAMILY MEDICINE PROVIDED $103,000 IN INDIGENT CARE AND $178,600 IN CHARITY CARE.

Activity2.Description: OBSTETRICS AND GYNECOLOGY RESIDENCY PROGRAM GRADUATED SIX FROM FOUR-YEAR PROGRAM BASED IN WOMENS HEALTH CENTER. HIGH RISK MATERNITY CLINIC AND OTHER CARE PROVIDED IN OUR 16-COUNTY REGION. SERVICES PROVIDED IN THE HEALTH CENTERS RESULTED IN 34,600 PATIENT ENCOUNTERS AND 1,700 DELIVERIES. INCLUDED IN THESE VOLUMES ARE HIGH-RISK MATERNAL FETAL MEDICAL SERVICES PROVIDED TO THE 16 COUNTIES IN WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA. FAMILY MEDICINE PROVIDED $127,000 IN INDIGENT CARE AND $1,809,700 IN CHARITY CARE.

Activity3.Description: REGIONAL SERVICES PROVIDED CONTINUING EDUCATION FOR HEALTH & HUMAN SERVICE PROFESSIONALS IN ALLIED HEALTH, DENTISTRY, HEALTHCARE LEADERSHIP, MEDICINE, MENTAL HEALTH, NURSING, PHARMACY AND PUBLIC HEALTH. ALSO EDUCATED IN HEALTH CAREERS & DIVERSITY AND CENTER FOR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT (IMPROVING PERFORMANCE IN PRACTICE & INTEGRATED CARE). REGIONAL EDUCATION PROVIDED OVER 924 CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO OVER 22,500 PARTICIPANTS IN WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA TO PROFESSIONALS IN ALL FIELDS OF HEALTHCARE.

ActivityOther.Description: GENERAL PRACTICE RESIDENCY PROGRAM IN DENTISTRY GRADUATED FOUR FROM ONE-YEAR PROGRAM. OPERATED PRACTICE SERVICING MEDICAID AND OTHER PATIENTS. SERVICES PROVIDED IN THE DENTAL HEALTH CENTER RESULTED IN 7,800 PATIENT ENCOUNTERS. DENTAL HEALTH CARE PROVIDED $7,000 IN INDIGENT CARE AND $40,100 IN CHARITY CARE.

ADMINISTRATION (REGIONAL OUTREACH)- INCLUDED IN ADMINISTRATION COSTS ARE HEALTH INFORMATION SERVICES PROVIDED TO WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH THE NORTH CAROLINA CENTER FOR HEALTH AND AGING, THE HEALTH SCIENCES LIBRARY AND THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY. COMBINED SERVICES OF THESE THREE FUNCTIONS SUPPORTED OVER 37,500 HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS.

VAN WINKLE BUCK WALL STARNES & DAVIS
ALLEN H VAN DYKE JR MD

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: KEY EMPLOYEE BOB HENDERSON, M.D. IS COMPENSATED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA CHAPEL HILL FOR HIS SERVICES RENDERED TO THE ORGANIZATION AS DIRECTOR OF OBGYN. PURSUANT TO THE CONTRACT HE RECEIVED $309,571 IN COMPENSATION AND $77,393 IN BENEFITS FOR THE 2009 CALENDAR YEAR.

NameOfInterestedPerson.NamePerson: MARIAN LINDA ROWE - OB MENTAL HEALT

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: WIFE OF JOHN ROWE, FAMILY MEDICINE MEDICAL DIRECTOR

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MAHEC BOARD FOLLOWED ITS 990 POLICY. THE GOVERNANCE/FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWED THE 990 AND FORWARDED A COPY TO EACH BOARD MEMBER PRIOR TO THE BOARD MEETING. THE GOVERNANCE/FINANCE COMMITTEE MADE A RECOMMENDATION FOR APPROVAL TO THE BOARD AND REVIEWED THE 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND RELATIONSHIP QUESTIONNAIRE ANNUALLY. AS PART OF THE POLICY AND THEIR DUTIES BOARD MEMBERS ABSTAIN FROM DISCUSSIONS AND VOTING WHEN POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARISE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNANCE/FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS KEY EMPLOYEES' SALARIES WITH A MARKET COMPARISON INCLUDING THE CEO, COO, CFO, AND DIVISION DIRECTORS. THE COMMITTEE MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS AND APPROVES THE SALARIES BEFORE THE BUDGET IS ADOPTED BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FROM THE PRESIDENT/CEO'S OFFICE AS WELL AS ONLINE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AT THE PRESIDENT OR CEO'S OFFICE.
